instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spin for ~0.5 seconds before it power off - this loops
threads.message:
Board looks like crap, has been worked on before. Shit ton of flux around the GPU

Been wokring on it for 15 minutes and I'm already to the point of giving up, probably the GPU is shorting something or messing something up.

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> <0.4Ohm (I don't think my multimeter can measure any lower)
Removing <RESISTOR>R8940</RESISTOR>, <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU_REG_R</SIGNAL> stays 0V.

Where to look? Is there some part I'm overlooking or should I just trash it already?

Cheers

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spin for ~0.5 seconds before it power off - this loops
threads.message: Anything getting hot? My guess is the GPU is dead.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spin for ~0.5 seconds before it power off - this loops
threads.message:
Everything cold, not feeling anything directly shorting. PPBUS stays around the same value (~12.5V) and the DC in doesn't cut out.

Dead GPU is extremely likely

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Fan spin for ~0.5 seconds before it power off - this loops
threads.message: It will need a new GPU at a minimum, it is shorted. You can pull the GPU, these board will power on and chime without. No video of course...
